articles.title: Lebanese protesters block roads against government inaction
articles.description: Lebanese protesters have blocked several roads around the capital of Beirut and other cities and towns in renewed rallies against the ruling elite they say has failed to address the economy's downward spiral
articles.content:
In downtown Beirut, dozens rallied outside the Central Bank, chanting against the governor and his financial policies. Security forces separated the protesters from the banks entrance.

articles.author: Mari Yamaguchi | AP
articles.title: Deputy prime minister calls Japan a nation with single race
articles.description: Japan's deputy prime minister has described the country as the only one in the world with a single race, language and 2,000-year-old monarchy, sparking criticism that he was ignoring an indigenous ethnic group and Japanese racial diversity
articles.content:
No other country but this one has lasted for as long as 2,000 years with one language, one ethnic group and one dynasty, Aso said in a speech Monday.

articles.title: Talks underway for Trump to visit India as impeachment heats up
articles.description: The visit would be Trump's first as president to the world's largest democracy
articles.content:
If finalized, the visit would be Trumps first to India as president. The United States has sought to cultivate India as a partner and potential counterweight to China, and Trump has spoken of his great admiration for Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
